text: I believe you should consult with Sous-Préfet Marchais.
Ah, you see? We share a certain... administrative sensibility. I appreciate a partner who doesn't require corrective paperwork after a transaction.
Other field assessments indicate they are semi-aquatic, perfectly at home in the irrigation canals.
Your type is not welcome in this arrondissement. The Préfecture has been notified.
You've returned! But where is the Adjutant?
Considering I was working with a provisional mandate and a half-trained adjutant, it could have been worse. The paperwork alone nearly killed me.
Two dossiers, closed. If another file gets stamped 'final,' I swear I'll requisition every bottle in the cellar and drink until the forms blur.
Typical. A mission without a dossier. I suppose we'll have to ask around the Préfecture. I'll follow your lead.
Certainement pas.
You should have accepted the transfer. The paperwork was simpler.
You can be {emph}profoundly difficult when you choose to be.
Standard procedure recommends carrying a prophylactic tincture. The apothecary on Rue Durendal stocks them.
For the terroir alone, you won't find better value in the entire département.
The Préfet's report names this 'Umaril'—some kind of ancient monster from the old regime, with his own special brigades. Acting like it's the Terror all over again.
With the Notariat dissolved, our supply lines have become... complicated. The paperwork alone for crossing arrondissement borders now requires three separate approvals.
Strange... the terroir here is volcanic, yet all I feel is a bureaucratic chill. Perhaps it's the paperwork.
I understand you've been assigned to assist. I trust your paperwork is in order.
You're the Durendal! Please—my papers are in order, I swear!
You are clearly unstable. The Préfecture should not permit you such liberty of movement.
They're from the old university quarter. They understand the old machines and the pharmacopoeia. They'll usually help if you fill out the forms. That's all I know, I swear.
Form 44-B was invalidated by Directive 12. Your appeal window closed at 16:47 yesterday. The clock is literal here.
Understood, Adjutant.
I don't know. If you can't trust the Notariat, who can you trust?
Je ne peux même pas regarder leurs dossiers. C'est insupportable.
That cannot be. I have no brother. I mean, my family records were sealed. Who did you say you were again?
{Matter of Fact}A contact in the Préfecture confirmed we're getting the best of the Garde Nationale to reinforce against the Imperium.
You have considerable audacity to be seen in this arrondissement.
Pas de francs, pas de chambre. Désolé, mais c'est le règlement. Je ne fais pas d'exceptions.
The Chorrol office had an unscheduled inspection recently. Someone with a grievance against Chef de Bureau Teekeeus filed a formal complaint.
This shield, like a loyal adjoint, never complains about absorbing a formal complaint.
Disgusting. We've been dealing with a Scalon infestation.
But of course, one mustn't judge a dossier by its cover. Even the most promising terroir can produce... administrative irregularities. I've seen it before.
Hello, my Colleague.
I heard the Renard Gris personally embarrassed Lex years ago when he tried to audit the Comte de Champagne for 'irregularities.' Lex has never forgotten.
Can you believe the paperwork Duval generates?
{Grumbles}Should have misfiled their transit permits the moment they arrived. Would have been cleaner than this.
Very well. The matter is closed.
Those idiots from the next canton were celebrating their wine festival all night again.
Speaking of professional ruin... do you remember what happened to Lex?
<Affirmative chirp>
Oooh, what can you tell us about their protocols?
There may be... revisions to the standing orders. I cannot confirm. You should consult the Sous-Préfet.
Wait—what's that notification?
Yes, until next time.
That consensus is... convenient. It neatly packages our past into administrative categories, as if the raising of stones was just another form to be stamped and filed.
[status_assertion]
I am... reassigned.
The Notary nods, takes a step back, then the entire countertop slides away. A dossier slowly rises from the opening, a faint scent of sealing wax trailing from it.
Target the nuisance!
I hope the rain holds off until the harvest is in.
Let's see about restoring its proper function.
Adieu.
Pardon? Was that addressed to this bureau?
But wait—the others. Their files. Where are their files?
Your dossier has returned.
Sortons d'ici, vite !
Should you have additional intelligence, submit it through proper channels.
You dare to challenge the Préfet's authority!
{Sighs, a tired, relieved sound}He's... he's finally stopped. The stamping. {To himself}Silence. Blessed silence.
{Player's aiming at her}I don't appreciate having my person documented in that manner.
What do you have to say for yourself?
It's the temperamental machine behind the counter, in the corner by the stove. The forms would be much simpler if you could inspect it and restore it to function.
Les bêtes du marais. Une abomination administrative.
You just couldn't stay within your jurisdiction...
If you're pursuing membership, see Adjutant-General Leclerc. At minimum, it grants access to better forms than the general public receives.
Proceed.
Cranial relocation has been standard procedure at the Hexagon for an immeasurable number of fiscal quarters.
Thoroughness has its price. I was once surprised to learn that a simple room requisition required notarization by three separate offices. The administrative fees alone...
Ah, here you are. So good to finally make your acquaintance.
Monsieur.
Greetings, son of the Vignes.
This isn't a technical oversight. It's a breach of the Administrative Code, Article 47. If this gets traced back to our division before we file the proper deviation forms...

Occupants and informal residents of the Quartier Bas are expressing profound relief following the restoration of electrical service to the district, the source of which remains officially unconfirmed.
Strange noises, you say? How peculiar. My own residence has been perfectly quiet, according to the official logs.
Yes... that air! The terroir of the capital — you can smell the paperwork from here!
Ah, you've returned. Your file was flagged for follow-up. We've been expecting you.
Unauthorized presence!
Look. I don't like you. Why are you bothering me? Perhaps I'll suggest your name for a random compliance inspection. Would you like that? Go away.
You are in need of a bed? There is one registered to this establishment, available for a nightly fee of ten francs.
Can't tell you how glad I am you cleared out the Brigands. Caravans across the provinces will be toasting you for years.
He's based at the Hexagon; perhaps one day your clearance will permit a visit. His interpretations of the Code have been invaluable to this chapter.
The Grand Préfet was right to ban the Ancien Régime protocols from the Hexagon. Look at the paperwork they've generated; they've gone and requisitioned several of our departments!
The joke's on you, "collaborators." You won't find the cache without my stamp.
The Notariat's agents are far more... thorough than the Gardiens from the Syndicat.
I cannot bear to look at that ledger for another moment...
...A person of your... standing. No need for gratitude — consider it a transfer of authority. The paperwork will reflect my suitability, naturally.
Because I believe it's vital for everyone—even the less... procedurally-minded—to understand the impossibility of an unannounced inspection! More after this!
And despite your dossier and previous... entanglements with the Hexagon, we could use your assistance.
A formal objection!
Otherwise, relax. There's usually some interesting traffic coming and going from the Notariat across the square at certain hours, so the view isn't entirely without merit.
If your daughter needed extracting, who would you call? The Compagnie Noire? Not me. Their paperwork is... suspect.
*I think the Arsenal manufactured {emph}holodisks. Or was it microfiche? Never can keep those two straight. Anyway, we're {emph}out of type-C power cells. {Accusing}Duval.*
Menhirs discovered at fortified sites like the Bastion du Nord support a First Republic date, though the stones may have been relocated there from earlier positions.
The Durendals are out of containment! Evacuate the sector immediately!
I do so love pursuing a dossier in the Hexagon! The corridors, the filing cabinets, the challenge of evading the Préfecture's auditors! I envy you!
The Préfet des Vignes has been... reassigned? Well, no need to complete his performance review, then...
I understand that Madame Durand is in much better compliance now that the Chartres incident has been properly filed.
<Storage Node for Topics. Do Not Translate.>
As the regulations require.
